text: on most days the view from Omar West's
rooftop is of this rather unspectacular
intersection in western Baghdad but on
September 16th mister when they hit him
from the back back mr. Wessel is one of
dozens of Iraqis interviewed by the New
York Times who witnessed the now famous
Blackwater incident and have
reconstructed it in similar detail mr.
West's account is startling because he
astonish the pro-american and a member
of the Patriotic Union of Kurdistan
party all of the witnesses interviewed
say the bullets were fired by guards
working for Blackwater USA a private
security company working in Iraq they
say also that the guards fired without
provocation and that the shooting
continued even as the victims fled for
their lives the Iraqi government
supports their claims and has called the
incident deliberate murder a US Army
report termed the shootings quote a
criminal event Blackwater has another
story the company declined an on-camera
interview but has maintained its guards
were under attack and responded
appropriately the State Department in a
statement issued shortly after the
attack supported Blackwater's assertion
that had fired in self-defense the
shooting has prompted investigations by
the FBI the State Department the US Army
and Iraqi authorities the incident on
this traffic circle is the third
high-profile shooting in recent months
involving Western security contractors
and it has raised larger questions about
justice in Iraq
the chain of events began shortly before
noon when a car bomb exploded near a
mosque about a mile from Nisour square
at the same time
a State Department delegation was
visiting a nearby compound Blackwater
was protecting that delegation and when
the bomb exploded guards quickly shut
out the delegation towards the safety of
the Green Zone a second Blackwater team
in for SUVs moved towards Nisour square
to help clear a route to safety police
officers Sarhan dia and Ali Calif were
directing traffic in the square both say
the shooting started without warning
[Music]
according to Blackwater three of its
vehicles were struck by bullets one was
disabled
oh hi fella p.m. bill Barbara Caravan I

at this point witnesses say cars made
u-turns and began to retreat in terror
but the guards kept firing US Army
personnel who arrived shortly after the
shooting said in a report that it
appeared Blackwater guards shot at the
fleeing vehicles this video obtained by
the New York Times supports those
statements it shows bullet ridden
vehicles pointed away from the square
the white truck appears to have been hit
with a 40-millimeter grenade a weapon
used exclusively by Americans though
Blackwater denies that their helicopters
fired during the incident the roof of
this truck has a gaping hole and Iraqi
investigators say that it was attacked
from above
Blackwater helicopters can still be seen
in this video taken immediately after
the shooting stopped Toxie driver
Barossa Doon was among the wounded that
day his x-rays showed the shards of
shrapnel that tore into his body as the
incident came to an end
mr. Wessler says there was a lull in the

Jordan today mr. square is back to
normal but Iraqi anger lingers still in
the four and a half years of war only
one Western security contractor has been
charged with a crime
Blackwater alone has been involved in
nearly 200 shootings since 2005 though
it is not known how many involved
civilians no Blackwater guards have been
prosecuted under US or Iraqi law
Blackwater's guards are among the ten
thousand-plus Western security
contractors working in Iraq and all of
them are immune from prosecution under a
2004 order signed by former ambassador
Bremer moments after the shooting the
Iraqi army arrived to help with the
wounded but mr. Wessel with an eye on
justice urged the unit to chase down the
